processSteps.title: Site Survey & Design
processSteps.subtitle: Week 1–4
processSteps.description: Topographic survey, soil investigation, architectural drawing, and structural design by NEC-certified engineers.

processSteps.title: Municipal Approval
processSteps.subtitle: Week 4–10
processSteps.description: Naksha Pass (building permit) processing at Ward Office or Municipal Corporation. We handle all documentation.

processSteps.title: Foundation
processSteps.subtitle: Month 3–5
processSteps.description: Excavation, PCC, RCC footing with seismic tie beams. Soil test-verified foundation depth with quality cement.

processSteps.title: Superstructure
processSteps.subtitle: Month 5–14
processSteps.description: RCC columns, beams, slabs, brickwork, waterproofing, and roof slab casting as per structural drawings.

processSteps.title: Finishing
processSteps.subtitle: Month 14–18
processSteps.description: Plumbing, electrical, flooring, plastering, painting, modular kitchen, and full interior as per BOQ.

processSteps.title: Handover
processSteps.subtitle: Month 18
processSteps.description: Final inspection, snagging, completion certificate, and key handover with 1-year defect liability period.

bio: WVN Construction was founded with a singular mission: to bring world-class engineering standards to Nepal's rapidly growing construction landscape — without compromising on local wisdom, affordability, or safety.

After the 2015 Gorkha Earthquake, we doubled down on seismic resilience, making IS 1893 compliance mandatory on every project. Today, every structure we build is engineered to withstand a 7.5 magnitude event — because in Nepal, that's not a feature, it's a responsibility.
